intro: Linnaea borealis f. polyoza, commonly known as the northern flame or twinflower, is a rare variant of the twinflower plant native to northern regions of North America and Eurasia. It is a low-growing evergreen shrub characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of delicate, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in shaded, forested environments. Its botanical features include a distinctive two-flowered inflorescence, which gives it its common name. This variant is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in boreal and subarctic ecosystems.
